1.global: The act of taking in water by mouth to hydrate or quench thirst.

hands.desc: Holding a cup or bottle and bringing it to the mouth.

legs.desc: No significant movement of the legs.

torso.desc: Slight forward lean to bring the cup to the mouth.

2.global: The action of consuming food for sustenance, nourishment, or pleasure.

hands.desc: Holding food or utensils for eating.

legs.desc: Seated or standing, legs typically stationary.

torso.desc: Torso typically remains upright, slight head motion while eating.

3.global: The act of cleaning teeth and gums using a toothbrush and toothpaste for oral hygiene.

hands.desc: Holding the toothbrush and moving it across the teeth.

legs.desc: Minimal leg movement, usually standing.

torso.desc: Head and torso might slightly tilt to ensure brushing angles.

4.global: Using a brush or comb to groom and style hair.

hands.desc: Holding the brush or comb, pulling through hair.

legs.desc: Minimal leg movement, typically seated or standing.

torso.desc: Head movement to guide the brush along the hair.

5.global: Releasing an object from one's grasp, allowing it to fall to the ground or another surface.

hands.desc: Releasing the object from the hand.

legs.desc: No movement of legs.

torso.desc: Minimal torso movement, just a natural release of the object.

6.global: Lifting or grasping an object with one's hands.

hands.desc: Grasping the object and lifting it.

legs.desc: Legs bend to allow bending down to pick up the object.

torso.desc: Torso might bend slightly forward during the action.

7.global: Projecting an object through the air using the hand or arm.

hands.desc: Holding the object and extending the arm to release it.

legs.desc: Legs may assist with the momentum for a stronger throw.

torso.desc: Torso rotation assists in the throw's force.

8.global: Moving from a standing position to a seated position.

hands.desc: Hands may help balance while sitting.

legs.desc: Bending the legs to lower the body into a seated position.

torso.desc: Torso flexes forward slightly to facilitate the action.

9.global: Transitioning from a seated position to an upright position by pushing up with the legs.

hands.desc: Hands may be placed on the knees or floor to assist in standing.

legs.desc: Legs push upward to lift the body into a standing position.

torso.desc: Torso rises as the legs straighten, potentially leaning forward to balance.

10.global: Striking one's palms together to make a sound, typically as a form of applause or approval.

hands.desc: Clapping hands together, rapidly bringing palms together and apart.

legs.desc: Legs remain stationary with no involvement in the clapping action.

torso.desc: Minimal torso movement, possibly a slight bend or rhythm for effect.

11.global: Interpreting and understanding written or printed words and symbols.

hands.desc: Holding the book or reading material.

legs.desc: Minimal leg movement, usually seated.

torso.desc: Torso and head slightly bent forward to focus on the material.

12.global: Using a pen, pencil, or other writing tool to create letters, words, or symbols on a surface.

hands.desc: Holding and moving the writing tool to create symbols on a surface.

legs.desc: Typically stationary, seated or standing.

torso.desc: Torso remains upright with occasional shifts for comfort.

13.global: Ripping apart paper into smaller pieces with the hands.

hands.desc: Gripping the paper and tearing it into pieces.

legs.desc: No significant movement from the legs.

torso.desc: Torso remains upright with minimal movement.

14.global: The act of putting on a jacket to cover the upper body and arms.

hands.desc: Reaching to pull the jacket's sleeves onto the arms.

legs.desc: Minimal leg movement, typically standing.

torso.desc: Torso motion to slip the arms into the jacket and pull it over the shoulders.

15.global: Removing a jacket from the body, typically by pulling it off the arms.

hands.desc: Grabbing the jacket's edges to pull it off the body.

legs.desc: Legs remain stationary during the action.

torso.desc: Torso rotates or leans to assist in removing the jacket.

16.global: The act of putting a shoe onto one's foot for protection or fashion.

hands.desc: Grabbing and positioning the shoe onto the foot.

legs.desc: Foot remains stationary while the other foot is lifted to place the shoe.

torso.desc: Minimal torso movement to assist in balancing the body during the action.

17.global: Removing a shoe from one's foot using one's hands.

hands.desc: Using the hands to grip and remove the shoe from the foot.

legs.desc: Foot lifted to assist in removing the shoe.

torso.desc: No significant torso movement, only slight balancing to assist the removal.

18.global: Placing eyeglasses or spectacles on the face to correct vision or protect the eyes.

hands.desc: Holding and positioning the glasses onto the face.

legs.desc: Legs remain stationary.

torso.desc: Head remains still while positioning glasses on the face.

19.global: Removing eyeglasses from one's face with one's hands.

hands.desc: Gripping and lifting the glasses off the face.

legs.desc: Minimal leg movement.

torso.desc: Minimal torso movement, only slight head tilt for better access.

20.global: Placing a hat or cap on the head for protection or fashion.

hands.desc: Reaching and placing the hat/cap onto the head.

legs.desc: Legs remain stationary, typically standing.

torso.desc: Minimal torso movement to adjust for placing the hat.

21.global: Removing a hat or cap from the head.

hands.desc: Grabbing the hat/cap and lifting it off the head.

legs.desc: No significant movement from the legs.

torso.desc: Minimal torso movement, just tilting the head or lifting the hat.

22.global: Attempting to improve one's or someone else's mood, typically by positive actions or gestures.

hands.desc: Clapping or giving a positive gesture to uplift the mood.

legs.desc: Legs may move to support a jump or dance to enhance the mood.

torso.desc: Torso may exhibit a change in posture, standing tall or jumping in excitement.

23.global: A gesture involving moving one's hand or hands to signal, greet, or draw attention.

hands.desc: Moving the hand back and forth in a waving motion.

legs.desc: Minimal movement from legs, typically standing or seated.

torso.desc: No significant torso movement, but slight lean or posture shift may accompany the gesture.

24.global: Striking an object with the foot.

hands.desc: No involvement of hands in the action.

legs.desc: Lifting the foot to strike an object with force.

torso.desc: Torso may twist slightly to assist with the kick’s power.

25.global: Extending one's hand into a pocket to retrieve an item or adjust the contents.

hands.desc: Reaching into the pocket and grasping an item.

legs.desc: Legs remain stationary, typically standing.

torso.desc: Torso leans slightly forward to reach into the pocket.

26.global: Jumping repeatedly on one foot, typically as part of a physical activity or exercise.

hands.desc: Hands may assist with balance or be held still.

legs.desc: The single foot is used for both jumping and landing while the other leg remains raised.

torso.desc: Torso may remain upright or shift slightly with each hop for balance.

27.global: Leaping upward from a standing position as part of physical training or for jumping activity.

hands.desc: Hands may be lifted to aid in the upward motion or for aesthetic purpose.

legs.desc: Both legs push off the ground to propel the body upwards.

torso.desc: Torso remains mostly upright, with slight forward or upward motion for balance.

28.global: Using a phone to initiate or receive a phone conversation.

hands.desc: Holding the phone to the ear and mouth for communication.

legs.desc: Typically stationary while holding the phone.

torso.desc: Torso remains upright while positioning the phone to the ear and speaking.

29.global: Manipulating a phone or tablet through various interactions such as tapping, swiping, or scrolling.

hands.desc: Tapping, swiping, or scrolling with fingers on the device’s screen.

legs.desc: Legs may remain still, typically seated in one place.

torso.desc: Torso remains upright, possibly slightly forward to interact with the screen.

30.global: Pressing keys on a keyboard to input information or commands into a computer or other device.

hands.desc: Using fingers to press keys on the keyboard.

legs.desc: Legs typically seated or stationary while typing.

torso.desc: Torso remains upright with minimal forward lean.

31.global: Extending the arm and using the finger to indicate or draw attention to an object or location.

hands.desc: Pointing the finger in the direction of the target.

legs.desc: Legs may remain stationary, body may slightly turn towards the target.

torso.desc: Torso may rotate slightly to aid in the pointing gesture.

32.global: Using a camera to take a self-portrait photograph.

hands.desc: Holding the camera or phone to capture the image.

legs.desc: Legs may remain still, typically standing or seated.

torso.desc: Torso and head may be adjusted to align with the camera for the selfie.

33.global: Looking at a wristwatch or other timekeeping device to determine the current time.

hands.desc: Raising the hand to the wristwatch to check the time.

legs.desc: No significant movement of legs.

torso.desc: Torso may rotate slightly to adjust the wrist for better visibility.

34.global: Moving one's hands back and forth against each other, often for warmth.

hands.desc: Rubbing the palms or fingers against each other to create friction.

legs.desc: Minimal leg movement.

torso.desc: Torso remains upright or stationary, with no significant movement.

35.global: Lowering one's head briefly in a sign of respect, greeting, or acknowledgment.

hands.desc: No significant movement of hands involved.

legs.desc: Legs remain still, minimal movement.

torso.desc: Slight forward or downward movement of the head and neck.

36.global: Moving the head from side to side in a rapid or deliberate manner, often to indicate disagreement.

hands.desc: No significant involvement of hands.

legs.desc: Legs remain stationary.

torso.desc: Head rotates side to side while torso remains relatively still.

37.global: Using a cloth or one's hands to remove dirt, sweat, or moisture from one's face.

hands.desc: Rubbing or wiping the face with the hands or a cloth.

legs.desc: Minimal movement of the legs.

torso.desc: Head and torso may shift slightly to assist in wiping the face.

38.global: A gesture of respect or greeting, typically performed by raising one's hand to the forehead or brim of a hat.

hands.desc: Raising the hand to the forehead or hat brim in a salute.

legs.desc: Legs remain still with no significant involvement.

torso.desc: Slight tilt or movement of the torso to support the hand's positioning.

39.global: Pressing one's hands together, often as a sign of respect, greeting, or prayer.

hands.desc: Pressing the palms together firmly.

legs.desc: Legs typically stationary.

torso.desc: Torso remains upright or slightly forward while pressing the hands together.

40.global: Crossing the arms in front of the body to indicate stopping or refusal.

hands.desc: Crossing the arms, placing one hand over the other in front of the body.

legs.desc: Minimal leg movement during this action.

torso.desc: Torso may rotate slightly to facilitate the gesture, but remains mostly stationary.

41.global: The involuntary or deliberate act of expelling air and sometimes mucus from the nose and mouth, typically due to illness or irritation.

hands.desc: Covering the mouth or nose with hands to prevent the spread of germs.

legs.desc: Minimal movement, typically standing or seated.

torso.desc: Torso may lean forward during the sneeze or cough, aiding in the expulsion.

42.global: The unsteady movement or swaying of the body, usually caused by intoxication, dizziness, or fatigue.

hands.desc: Hands may be used for balance, gripping onto objects for support.

legs.desc: Unstable, shifting movement of the legs to maintain balance.

torso.desc: Torso sways or tilts to help stabilize the body during the stagger.

43.global: The sudden loss of balance resulting in a person dropping or collapsing to the ground or a lower surface.

hands.desc: Hands may attempt to break the fall or shield the face and body.

legs.desc: Legs typically give way as part of the fall, with no control over movement.

torso.desc: Torso may bend or twist as the body loses balance and falls.

44.global: Placing one's hands on the head to alleviate pain or discomfort in the head or neck area.

hands.desc: Hands placed gently or pressing against the head or temples.

legs.desc: Minimal movement, usually seated or standing still.

torso.desc: Torso remains upright, possibly tilting the head slightly for relief.

45.global: Placing a hand on the chest to alleviate discomfort or pain in the chest area.

hands.desc: Placing a hand or both hands on the chest in response to discomfort.

legs.desc: Legs may remain still, typically standing or seated.

torso.desc: Torso remains upright, potentially leaning slightly for relief.

46.global: Placing one's hands on the back to alleviate or investigate pain, discomfort, or tension.

hands.desc: Hands placed on the lower or upper back to provide comfort.

legs.desc: Minimal leg movement, typically standing or seated.

torso.desc: Torso may twist or bend slightly to relieve tension in the back.

47.global: Pressing or rubbing the neck with one's hands, often to relieve pain or discomfort in the neck area.

hands.desc: Hands pressing or massaging the neck area for relief.

legs.desc: Legs remain still, with minimal involvement in the action.

torso.desc: Torso remains upright, with potential slight tilting or bending of the neck for comfort.

48.global: A condition characterized by the urge to vomit or the act of forcefully expelling stomach contents through the mouth.

hands.desc: Hands may be placed on the mouth or stomach for control.

legs.desc: Legs may be bent or in an unstable position during nausea or vomiting.

torso.desc: Torso may lean forward in response to the urge or action of vomiting.

49.action: Using a fan (with hand or paper) to feel warm
49.global: Creating airflow with a handheld or paper fan to either cool down or create warmth.

hands.desc: Holding and moving the fan back and forth.

legs.desc: Minimal movement of the legs, typically standing or seated.

torso.desc: Torso may lean slightly forward or backward to create airflow efficiently.

50.global: Striking another person with one's fist or open hand, typically for physical harm or aggression.

hands.desc: Fist or open hand strikes the other person with force.

legs.desc: Legs may assist with the power or stance for balance during the strike.

torso.desc: Torso rotates or shifts to add power to the punch or slap.

51.global: Striking another person with one's foot, often for physical harm or aggression.

hands.desc: Minimal involvement of hands in the action.

legs.desc: The foot is lifted and extended to strike the person.

torso.desc: Torso may rotate or lean to add strength to the kick.

52.global: Applying force to another person with one's body, typically with the intent to move or manipulate them.

hands.desc: Pushing the person with hands or palms.

legs.desc: Legs may assist in pushing by providing stability or force.

torso.desc: Torso leans forward or shifts to provide power to the push.

53.action: Patting on back of other person
53.global: Lightly striking or tapping another person's back with one's hand.

hands.desc: Patting the back of the other person with a light, comforting motion.

legs.desc: No significant leg movement involved in this action.

torso.desc: Torso remains stationary with minimal involvement in the action.

54.action: Pointing finger at the other person
54.global: Extending one's finger towards another person, typically to indicate something or express disapproval.

hands.desc: Pointing with the index finger towards the other person.

legs.desc: Legs typically remain stationary, often with body rotating slightly towards the other person.

torso.desc: Torso may rotate or shift to aim the point directly at the person.

55.global: Embracing another person with one's arms, often as a gesture of affection or comfort.

hands.desc: Wrapping arms around the other person for a hug.

legs.desc: Legs may shift position to accommodate the hug, typically standing.

torso.desc: Torso leans toward the other person to initiate the hug.

56.global: Transferring an object or item to another person, typically as a gift or exchange.

hands.desc: Handing over the item to the other person.

legs.desc: Minimal involvement of legs, typically stationary.

torso.desc: Torso may lean slightly to hand over the object.

57.global: Coming into contact with or manipulating the pocket of another person's clothing.

hands.desc: Touching or adjusting the pocket area of another person's clothing.

legs.desc: Legs remain stationary with no involvement in this action.

torso.desc: Minimal torso movement involved while reaching for the pocket.

58.global: Greeting another person by clasping and shaking their hand, typically as a gesture of respect or friendliness.

hands.desc: Clasping and shaking the other person's hand.

legs.desc: Legs remain stationary or with slight shifts for balance.

torso.desc: Torso remains upright, sometimes leaning slightly forward in greeting.

59.global: Moving one's body towards another person while standing or walking.

hands.desc: Hands may move naturally with walking, minimal involvement.

legs.desc: Walking towards the other person, with one leg stepping forward after the other.

torso.desc: Torso remains upright, with minimal leaning or turning during the walk.

60.global: Moving away from another person while standing or walking.

hands.desc: Hands move naturally while walking, no significant movement.

legs.desc: Legs take steps to create distance between the two people.

torso.desc: Torso remains upright with a slight shift or turn to walk away.
